sorry am new to this how do I mount my external drive?
usb hdd should have mounted automaticlay, are you running native ubuntu or in a virtual machine ?
maybe its not mounting cuz its in NTFS format? could that be?

should mount as read only , try this , type blkid in the terminal see if you see the drive listed,   if it is ,  find the /dev/... for it ,  , make a mount point     sudo mkdir /media/ntfs-usb   then mount it  sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/.... /media/ntfs-usb
: here's my external drive as listed by blkid /dev/sdb1: UUID="6B6C8A2B6C89419" LABEL="External Drive" TYPE="ntfs"
so I should now create a mount directory and continue mounting it?
sudo mkdir /media/ntfs-usb   then  sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sdb1 /media/ntfs-usb
Failed due to " Mount is denied because NTFS is marked to be in use."
it would appear that the usb drive is already mounted,  check on your desktop for an icon for it
It worked! woot. I had to force it with " mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sdb1 /media/ntfs-usb -o force"
